bio: Alissa is a photojournalism and anthropology major from Cary, N.C. She dreams of and aspires to help create a world where chickens can cross the road without being questioned. Her camera is her tool to spark conversations about the seemingly insignificant.
Sophia Nahli is a graduate student studying visual journalism. She is from Los Angeles, CA. Sophia is a black kween and believes Jimi Hendrix is her spirit animal.

A senior double majoring in broadcast journalism and global studies, Paris aspires to help people of all cultures and ages tell their own stories via citizen journalism. In addition to Panama, she has told stories across North Carolina and in Philadelphia, PA., Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand and Morocco.

Carolyn is a freelance designer and illustrator. She likes to draw food and tinker with type. She is very interested in the intersection between physical and digital products and the branding behind them.

Alexis, aka the 360 Stitch Master, is a junior studying multimedia journalism, media production, and history. Alexis is a developer for "The Watchman" on this site and works with post-production of the 360 videos. At any time she can be spotted sitting at a computer listening to music.
Claire was born in Hong Kong and grew up in Amman, Jordan. She studies photojournalism and likes to climb trees.

Be it in the field chasing wild bulls with gauchos in Patagonia or behind the desk editing the lives behind the making of a t-shirt, Nacho's passion is using storytelling to portray human nature. His work has been published by National Geographic, NPR, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Time magazine and Univision. Additionally, some of his most rewarding assignments have come through UNHCR, where he works with internally displaced communities as well as refugees around the world.
Kira is a junior at UNC-Chapel Hill. She is a photojournalism major from Asheville, N.C. Kira enjoys hiking, reading, traveling and spending time with her family.

Pat has been teaching photo, video and documentary multimedia storytelling at UNC since 2001. During that time, he has produced more than 25 team multimedia projects from North Carolina to Buenos Aires and the Galapagos Islands to Thailand. These projects have been recognized by the Webby Awards, SXSW Interactive, Pictures of the Year International, The Best of Photojournalism, and others.

Dillon is a senior photojournalism student at UNC. He strives to satisfy his journalistic curiosity and explore the world around him through human-interest stories. Dillon likes to travel, go on long road trips and explore life outside of the city.

Cori is a senior graphic design and interactive multimedia major who loves being artistic and creative and hates writing team bios. She was born and raised in Winter Park, Florida, and has loved art and design since she was a little girl. She has hated writing bios since the past 3-4 minutes, but she anticipates that the feeling will last.

Clare is a Ph.D. candidate in Ecology at UNC. Her research focuses on coral reef ecology and conservation, and her photography is represented by National Geographic Creative. Her career bridges science and media, but she's really in it for the wild off-roading in far off places.

Anne Marie is a broadcast journalism major with a minor in history and music at UNC and works as an Assignment Editor for WRAL-TV News. She is pursuing a career as an international political reporter, focusing on humanitarian issues. She likes to play anything by Chopin on the piano, pretend she is good at running, indulge with coffee ice cream and watch New Girl.
Aleah is a first-year master's student in visual journalism from Willow Spring, N.C. She is interested in how new media creates an intersection between journalism and activism.

Steve is a communications strategist and producer based in Washington, D.C. His work focuses on using storytelling to help people by working with nonprofits, NGOs, foundations and news organizations. His work has been featured in The New York Times, the Miami Herald, Reuters, ESPN and The Weather Channel.
Tegan is a senior photojournalism major from Raleigh, N.C. Her friends know her as the "Sloth Whisperer."
Steven is a professor to Tar Heels and a former muckraker for The Washington Post. As a master of computer science, he works with various technologies, such as virtual reality, to tell stories.

Michelle is a visual storyteller with photo, video and graphic storytelling chops. She loves listening to people's stories, learning new things, discovering the unexpected and uses her camera as an excuse to be nosy... in a good way.

Brittany is an awkward human who has a passion for spinning visual stories from simple lines of code. She claims she is of above average height, has an above average interest in Sassy CSS and has an above average knack for making something from nothing. Brittany is easily amused, and (when she has time) enjoys watching Hulu/Netflix, cooking new recipes and telling fantastic jokes about deer.

Krista is a 2016 graduate with a specialization in editing and graphic design. She's currently trying to reconcile her passion for design and youth ministry with a longing to go back to Australia, where she studied abroad. Also, she likes playing in dirt.
Caroline is a multimedia major and studio art minor who loves to create. She appreciates life's beauty and hopes to use her skills to share that beauty with the world.

Andrea is from Iron Station, N.C. She is majoring in multimedia and minoring in computer science. When she's not coding, she enjoys eating jelly beans and imagining a world where George R.R. Martin actually publishes a book when he says he will.

Laura put aside her duties as director of the MATC program to travel to the beautiful island of Bocas del Toro to coach students in design, usability and storytelling while sipping drinks poolside. She might also be the first person to suggest a usability and eye-tracking study while producing in the field. Prior to this project, she led "Powering a Nation" to numerous awards.
Kiersten is a first-year graduate student and interactive designer focused on data visualization and graphic storytelling. She prefers to code with her cat, Sebastian, curled up on her lap.
Patrick is a media and journalism major from Raleigh, N.C. In addition to web development, he enjoys writing music and hiking.

Poems and prose and creating pathos. This is what Janell is made of. A senior majoring in journalism and global studies, Janell has used her writing and reporting to promote public service, social justice and participation in local government. She plans to combine her passion for writing and community as she pursues her juris doctor in immigration law.

Mac is a senior video/photojournalism student who lives for good dogs, good meals, and well-told stories. He gets most excited when meeting new people and adventuring into the unknown, and he can't wait to see where his camera takes him next.

Anna is a first year M.A. student studying visual journalism. Prior to coming to UNC, she spent three years freelancing in Cambodia, where she learned to love homemade noodles, extremely hot weather, street dogs, and long bike rides. Anna is passionate about telling empowering stories about women.

Casey is a visual journalist native to North Carolina with a consistent hankering for good food and open spaces. She loves telling stories about our food production system, big or small, and the resulting environmental impacts, good or bad. Working on "Built with Bananas" was a dream come true for her.

Justina is a writer on the project and a junior at UNC-Chapel Hill majoring in business journalism with an ~unofficial~ minor in data journalism & visualization. She enjoys being part of innovation in the media industry and prefers jazz music and Wes Anderson-esque films to many other pastimes.

Kristi is a senior from Albemarle, N.C., studying design and interactive storytelling at UNC-Chapel Hill. She hopes to pursue a career as a developer in visual journalism. If she's not at her computer, she's likely in the yoga studio or out hiking.
